title: Make `saturating_add` and `saturating_sub` `const` functions

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

body:
These used to require `if` to work, but are forwarded to llvm intrinsics nowadays (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/58003). We can now implement them as const eval intrinsics, too.

Impl instructions:

1. add to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/0c0c585281740aba4c91cbfd385f5e1fbe313d11/src/librustc_mir/transform/qualify_min_const_fn.rs#L371
2. remove `unsafe` for calls to the intrinsic
3. add to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/51cc3cdcf060c1bf3e4d45947f7a6bc20f9960f7/src/librustc_mir/transform/qualify_consts.rs#L820
4. make functions calling the intrinsic `const fn`
5. Implement in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/79d8a0fcefa5134db2a94739b1d18daa01fc6e9f/src/librustc_mir/interpret/intrinsics.rs#L102 (implementation is basically the two `read_immediate` calls, a call to `binary_op_imm` with arguments similar to the other add/sub intrinsics, in case the overflow bool in the return value is false, write the actual value to the destination like in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/79d8a0fcefa5134db2a94739b1d18daa01fc6e9f/src/librustc_mir/interpret/operator.rs#L36 . In case the overflow bool is true, compute the min or max value of the type like in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/79d8a0fcefa5134db2a94739b1d18daa01fc6e9f/src/librustc_mir/interpret/operator.rs#L217 and write that value to `dest`.
6. Write some tests that use the saturating methods in constants
